Event.name: Communication_response
Event.definition:
<def-root>This frame deals with a <fen>Speaker</fen> communicating a reply or response, a <fen>Message</fen>, to some prior communication or action, the <fen>Trigger</fen>. <ex></ex> <ex><fex name="Speaker">The landlord</fex> has not yet <t>replied</t> <fex name="Medium">in writing</fex> <fex name="Addressee">to the tenant</fex> <fex name="Message">objecting the proposed alterations</fex>.<fex name="Trigger">DNI</fex></ex>
<ex><fex name="Message">"No, I do not agree with you,"</fex> <t>responded</t> <fex name="Speaker">another officer</fex> <fex name="Addressee">to the CEO</fex>. <fex name="Trigger">DNI</fex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Speaker
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity that communicates the reply or response. It is expressed as the External Argument of predicative uses of a <t>Target</t> verb or as the Genitive modifier of a <t>Target</t> noun: <ex><fex name="Spkr">Sue</fex> <t>responded</t> to the objection convincingly.</ex> <ex><fex name="Spkr">Sue</fex> gave a convincing <t>response</t>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Spkr">Sue's</fex> <t>response</t> was convincing.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Addressee
Arg.definition: <def-root>This is the person to whom the response is communicated. When expressed, this FE occurs as the direct object of a <t>Target</t> verb, or in a prepositional phrase introduced by "to": <ex>Sue <t>answered</t> <fex name="Add">Bob</fex> immediately.</ex> <ex>Sue <t>responded</t> <fex name="Add">to Bob</fex> immediately.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Message
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Message</fen> is the FE that identifies the content of what the <fen>Speaker</fen> is communicating to the <fen>Addressee</fen>. It can be expressed as a direct quote or a clause.<ex><fex name="Msg">"I can't help you,"</fex> Sue <t>answered</t>.</ex><ex>Sue <t>replied</t> <fex name="Msg">that she couldn't help</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Topic
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Topic</fen> occurs quite rarely in this frame and usually only as a PP Complement of a noun <t>Target</t>:<ex>My boss still hasn't given me an <t>answer</t> <fex name="Top">about a promotion</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Medium
Arg.definition: <def-root>As with <fen>Medium</fen> in other Communication frames, the physical entity or channel used to communicate can be expressed, usually as a PP Complement headed by "on" or "in":<ex>Sue <t>responded</t> to my question <fex name="Medium">on the telephone</fex>.</ex><ex>Sue <t>replied</t> <fex name="Medium">in writing</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Trigger
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Trigger</fen> is the prior communication or action to which a response is given. It can occur as an NP Object or a PP Complement.<ex>Sue <t>answered</t> <fex name="Trig">the question</fex>.</ex><ex>Sue <t>responded</t> <fex name="Trig">to the questionnaire</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>Depictive phrase describing the <fen>Speaker</fen>. <ex>Her husband <t>responded</t> to the police officer's query, <fex name="Depict">smoldering</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by the <fen>Speaker</fen> achieves the communication of the response <fen>Message</fen> .</def-root>

Arg.name: Internal_cause
Arg.definition: <def-root>The response may be prompted by either some outside phenomenon or occurrence, or by an <fen>Internal_cause</fen>, the Agent's mental or emotional state. <fen>Internal_cause</fen> is expressed in a PP Complement: <ex>Kim <t>responded</t> <fex name="ICause">out of renewed hope</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The location in which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes a verbal response.
<ex>This was how Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Jayalalithaa <t>responded</t> <fex name="pla">in the Assembly</fex> on November 5, 2003.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The time interval during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes their verbal response.
<ex>A reminder letter was sent to all nonrespondents who had not <t>replied</t> <fex name="tim">after 28 days</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An action that the <fen>Speaker</fen> intends to accomplish by making a verbal response.
<ex> We <t>replied</t> <fex name="pur">so as to shut you up and possibly, just possibly prevent this from happening again</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Duration</fen> of the communication response.
<ex>He <t>responded</t> <fex name="Duration">for five minutes</fex> before letting anyone else get a word in.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: answer.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: something said, written, or done as a reaction to a question, statement, or situation.

lexUnit.name: comeback.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a quick reply to a critical remark.

lexUnit.name: counter.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: speak or act in opposition or response to.

lexUnit.name: rejoinder.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a sharp or witty reply

lexUnit.name: reply.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a spoken or written response to something spoken or written

lexUnit.name: reply.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: say or write something in response to something said or written

lexUnit.name: respond.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: say something in reply or as a reaction.

lexUnit.name: response.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an instance of responding; an answer or reaction.

lexUnit.name: retort.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a sharp, angry, or witty reply.

lexUnit.name: retort.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: say something sharp, angry, or witty in answer to a remark or accusation

lexUnit.name: acknowledge.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to respond to communication without further information
